etymologies: Middle English (originally denoting a type of cucking-stool): from Old French tomberel, from tomber ‘to fall’

definitions: an open cart that tilted backward to empty out its load, in particular one used to convey condemned prisoners to the guillotine during the French Revolution.
shortDefinitions: open cart that tilted backwards to empty out its load

definitions: a two-wheeled covered cart which carried tools or ammunition for an army.
shortDefinitions: two-wheeled covered cart which carried tools or ammunition for army
